Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis; interior: added red band at rim, glazed black below; on top of rim, frieze of rays; exterior: at rim, band of vertical strokes above black band at junction with body; below, two incised spoked rosettes with red on alternate petals; below, part of narrow band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as Oxford G549 and British Museum 1886,0401.1117.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 330, no. B378)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 39, pl. XX, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2087)
